description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2s5rc","text":"TBE and TAE buffers are often used in procedures involving nucleic acids, the most common being electrophoresis. Tris-acid solutions are effective buffers for slightly basic conditions, which keep DNA deprotonated and soluble in water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ulai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvp93","text":"EDTA is a chelator of divalent cations, particularly of magnesium (Mg2+). As these ions are necessary cofactors for many enzymes, including contaminant nucleases, the role of the EDTA is to protect the nucleic acids against enzymatic degradation. But since Mg2+ is also a cofactor for many useful DNA-modifying enzymes such as restriction enzymes and DNA polymerases, its concentration in TBE or TAE buffers is generally kept low (typically at around 1 mM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":327,"length":19},{"key":1,"offset":351,"length":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"111rj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69r0p","text":"TBE buffer is used  to prepare agarose gels and as running buffer in agarose gel electrophoresis to separate and identify and analyse nucleic acids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5du9f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c54ef","text":" SCOPE:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"520cm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s0cl","text":"This protocol covers the steps involved in making 1L of 10x TBE buffer from Tris, Borate and EDTA powders","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgup7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ane8k","text":" DEFINITIONS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qvt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjtfn","text":"TBE: Tris Borate guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1v09","text":"This procedure can be performed by laboratory staff that have been trained and have theoretical and practical skills in good laboratory practices. It can also be performed by molecular biology students or students of related fields under the supervision of a laboratory staff.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8btpi","text":"Use an electronic balance to weigh out   Tris base (CAS# 77-86-1, free base) into a   ml or higher volume beaker ( depending on what volume of beaker is available and should be big enough to contain the powders to be dissolved).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":41,"length":9},{"key":2,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"108","error":false,"guid":"1C1AD150C22911EC8CA6D3C08B1E157A","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7CF054C5C22911EC94CE0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tris"}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"0C4B4BD0C23111EC811DCDEA602F03A9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cj4v","text":"Adjust volume to   by adding   of distilled or deionised water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":17,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"3A74F080C22A11EC8CA6D3C08B1E157A","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"427399D0C22A11EC8CA6D3C08B1E157A","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75tbn","text":"Measure    distilled or deionised water using a measuring cylinder, pour into the   beaker and stir for   either manually or using a magnetic stirrer and flea.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5bv1n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9bdps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17uas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"29D654D0C22A11EC8CA6D3C08B1E157A","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"83C96C30C7B011EC8CEAC1A8043F2903","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"A7C44BF0C22911EC8CA6D3C08B1E157A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eoc46","text":"If the TBE buffer will be used for RNA work, ensure that RNase-free water is used.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jt62","text":"Weigh  EDTA, disodium salt dihydrate (Cas# 6381-92-6, C10H14N2Na2O8· 2H2O, MW: 372.24) into a weighing boat and pour into the beaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":55,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":58,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":61,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":64,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":66,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":71,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"d5r2r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9rl3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9.3","error":false,"guid":"2EF95570C22A11EC8CA6D3C08B1E157A","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E8BAD794C22911EC94CE0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/GB/en/search/6381-92-6?focus=products\u0026page=1\u0026perpage=30\u0026sort=relevance\u0026term=6381-92-6\u0026type=cas_number"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":27},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":46},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":88}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b882q","text":"Note that you can also use   EDTA solution at  .
